info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 4:22AM PDT by NWS Elko NV
info.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada...
Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County.
.Very warm temperatures this week will melt high mountain snow, resulting in elevated creek flows.
For the Lamoille Creek...including Lamoille...elevated river levels are occurring.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues.
* WHERE...Lamoille Creek above Lamoille.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, Action stage. Visitors to Lamoille Canyon and the Powerhouse Picnic Area need to use extreme caution around Lamoille Creek and other creeks in the Ruby Mountains. Pets, children, and even adults can be swept away in strong currents.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:10 AM PDT Tuesday the stage was 3.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 4.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued by 700 AM PDT Wednesday morning. Wednesday morning at 700 AM PDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
